derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as an adjective and adverb): from Old French, or from Latin triplus, from Greek triplous

entry.tran: 三个的;三方的;三部分的
entry.def: Triple means consisting of three things or parts.

example.ex: In 1882 Germany, Austria, and Italy formed the Triple Alliance.
example.tran: 1882 年，德国、奥地利和意大利结成了三国同盟。

entry.def: If something triples or if you triple it, it becomes three times as large in size or number.

example.ex: I got a fantastic new job and my salary tripled...
example.tran: 我得到了一份非常好的新工作，薪水涨到了原来的 3 倍。

example.ex: The Exhibition has tripled in size from last year...
example.tran: 展览会规模自去年已经扩至3倍。

entry.def: If something is triple the amount or size of another thing, it is three times as large.

example.ex: The mine reportedly had an accident rate triple the national average...
example.tran: 据报道,该矿事故发生率是全国平均水平的 3 倍。

example.ex: The kitchen is triple the size it once was.
example.tran: 厨房面积扩为原先的 3 倍。

means.word_mean: 1. a base hit at which the batter stops safely at third base
2. a quantity that is three times as great as another
1. having three units or components or elements;

sentences.sentence: "triple time has three beats per measure"

means.word_mean: 2. three times as great or many;

means.word_mean: 三倍的, 三方的, 三部分的

sentences.en: He received triple wages for all his extra work.
sentences.cn: 由于额外的工作他领取了三倍的工资。
敌军把兵力增加到原来的三倍。

jushi.english: Black unemployment rate is triple the figure for white.
jushi.chinese: 黑人的失业率是白人的三倍。

jushi.english: The amount of alcohol in his blood was triple the legal maximum.
jushi.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量为法定最高限量的三倍。
